intro: Spilanthes rhombifolia, commonly known as the rhombic bladderflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its distinctive, rhomboid-shaped leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers. Spilanthes rhombifolia is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
